023
024package org.opt4j.operators.mutate;
025
026import java.util.Random;
027
028import org.opt4j.core.common.random.Rand;
029import org.opt4j.core.genotype.PermutationGenotype;
030
031import com.google.inject.Inject;
032
033/**
034 * <p>
035 * Mutate for the {@link PermutationGenotype}. With a given mutation rate each
036 * element is inserted on a different position.
037 * </p>
038 * 
039 * <p>
040 * Given a permutation {@code 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8}, this might result in {@code 1 2
041 * 6 3 4 5 7 8}.
042 * </p>
043 * 
044 * @author lukasiewycz
045 * 
046 */
047public class MutatePermutationInsert implements MutatePermutation {
048
049        protected final Random random;
050
051        /**
052         * Constructs a new {@link MutatePermutation} with the given mutation rate.
053         * 
054         * @param random
055         *            the random number generator
056         */
057        @Inject
058        public MutatePermutationInsert(Rand random) {
059                this.random = random;
060        }
061
062        /*
063         * (non-Javadoc)
064         * 
065         * @see
066         * org.opt4j.operator.mutate.Mutate#mutate(org.opt4j.core.problem.Genotype,
067         * double)
068         */
069        @Override
070        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
071        public void mutate(PermutationGenotype<?> genotype, double p) {
072                PermutationGenotype<Object> permutation = (PermutationGenotype<Object>) genotype;
073                int size = permutation.size();
074
075                if (size > 1) {
076                        for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
077                                if (random.nextDouble() < p) {
078                                        Object object = permutation.remove(i);
079                                        int j = random.nextInt(permutation.size());
080
081                                        permutation.add(j, object);
082                                }
083                        }
084                }
085        }
086
087}
